summary: Update handlers should retry when they fail with retryable exceptions like RuntimeException, similar to activity retry behavior. A test case exists in the features repository to validate this behavior.
userImpact: Update handlers that fail with retryable exceptions are not being retried, causing updates to fail immediately instead of following the configured retry policy.
rootCause: Update retry logic does not properly classify and handle retryable exceptions like RuntimeException.
resolutionDetails: Update retry logic was implemented to properly handle retryable exceptions for update handlers, aligning with activity retry behavior.
keyQuote: When an Update fails with a retryable exception like RuntimeException the update should be retried.
